definitions.definition: ( obsolete ) To take by the arm ; to take up in one's arms.

main_definition: ( obsolete ) To take by the arm ; to take up in one's arms.

definitions.definition: To supply with armour or (later especially) weapons .
examples: The king armed his knights with swords and shields.

definitions.definition: To supply with the equipment , knowledge , authority , or other tools needed for a particular task; to furnish with capability ; to equip .
To prepare (a tool , weapon , or system ) for action ; to activate .
examples: Remember to arm the alarm system before leaving for work.

definitions.definition: To become prepared for action ; to activate .
definitions.label_groups: intransitive , of a tool , weapon , or system

definitions.definition: To cover or furnish with a plate , or with whatever will add strength , force , security , or efficiency .
examples: to arm the hilt of a sword; to arm a hook in angling

definitions.definition: To take up weapons ; to arm oneself.
To fit (a magnet ) with an armature .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To supply with armour or (later especially) weapons .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , figurative ) To supply with the equipment , knowledge , authority , or other tools needed for a particular task; to furnish with capability ; to equip .
( transitive ) To prepare (a tool , weapon , or system ) for action ; to activate .
( intransitive , of a tool , weapon , or system ) To become prepared for action ; to activate .
( transitive ) To cover or furnish with a plate , or with whatever will add strength , force , security , or efficiency .
( intransitive ) To take up weapons ; to arm oneself.
( transitive ) To fit (a magnet ) with an armature .
